etymology.description: Line on hand (depicting forearm position) associated with measurement -> position near wrist for pulse -> unit of measurement
etymology.interpretation: 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch") originates from an ideogram showing a specific position on the arm, highlighting the measurement from the wrist to the point where the pulse is felt. This evolved into the meaning of an 'inch.'

examples.chinese: 这把尺子每一寸都很精致(這把尺子每一寸都很精緻)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bǎ chǐzi měi yī cùn dōu hěn jīngzhì.
examples.english: Every inch of this ruler is exquisite.

examples.chinese: 木匠测量木板时(木匠測量木板時)，确保每寸精确(確保每寸精確)。
examples.pinyin: Mùjiàng cèliáng mùbǎn shí, quèbǎo měi cùn jīngquè.
examples.english: When the carpenter measures the wood, he ensures every inch is precise.

examples.chinese: 他用手指比划出一寸的距离(他用手指比劃出一寸的距離)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng shǒuzhǐ bǐhuà chū yī cùn de jùlí.
examples.english: He measured out an inch with his finger.
